byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt reported from Washington, and Neil MacFarquhar from Moscow.
byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and NEIL MacFARQUHAR

abstract: Russia is moving more military aircraft, equipment and personnel into Syria, significantly increasing its presence and capabilities in region; United States officials worry about accidental military confrontations and Russia's ulterior motives; Israel fears influx of Russian arms into region will improve Hezbollah's access to them.
lead_paragraph: Two dozen new planes are part of an arms buildup at the base, appearing to leave little doubt about Moscow’s goal of establishing a Middle Eastern military outpost.

headline.main: Russia Expands Fleet in Syria With Jets That Can Attack Targets on Ground
headline.print_headline: Russia Expands Fleet in Syria With Jets That Can Attack Targets on Ground

snippet: Two dozen new planes are part of an arms buildup at the base, appearing to leave little doubt about Moscow’s goal of establishing a Middle Eastern military outpost.
